intro: Mandarus rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed mandrake, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces orange-red berries that contain toxic seeds, making it important to handle with care. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional remedies, though it is not widely cultivated today. The species is also noted for its ornamental value in certain horticultural settings.
